title: Revoke Ban, Feel As It Was Unfair
body:
I was playing a game tonight, and these two people on my team told my to kill myself and that i was a worthless piece of shit and a waste of oxygen, and i told the other team to report them but I was the one who got banned, and permanently. I feel as if this ban was unnecessary because I was the victim to the abuse and not a part of it please take the time to look at this as this is very tilting for being banned for being flamed at.

Thank you

replies.body:
Hi Pulsefire Dolan!

As others have mentioned, you should have received an email with the specific chat lines that triggered your ban. If you did not, with your permission I am able to share the logs here with you as a means of discussing why the behaviour was unacceptable in League. 

To clarify, it was not a single instance (the game you are referring to in your OP) that resulted in your perma-ban. You have previously been banned for consistent, moderate to high levels of negative and unsportsmanlike behaviour, including - what I gathered from skimming the chatlogs - intention to tilt or grieve players on your own team for amusement.

> Yeah as severe as it is, unfortunately in this game you have to be a little bitch and put up with anything anyone says to you, even if it's a death threat.

I've personally found the best way to deal with a toxic player in-game is to do the coveted, "Mute them" method. A lot of players also do ping-spam on you and you can mute that too! Once you've done that, just forget about them and play the game. 

Having a typing contest with someone in-game does not necessarily make you less of "a little bitch". Taking the high road and being mature tho? Badassss!

> Having a typing contest with someone in-game does not necessarily make you less of "a little bitch". Taking the high road and being mature tho? Badassss!

No of course this game isn't about whoever is the biggest "badass", but if someone told you to kill yourself would you just turn around and walk away? If you are THAT nice of a person maybe but not everyone is like that, if someone said that to me I would get up at the guy.
 
"Hey dude, what the fuck, that was rude" 
"What is wrong with you?" 
"Wow this guy is such an ass"

All perfectly humane responses to something like that but Riot would see it as flaming in chat and you get punished for it.
Sure you say "don't fight fire with fire" but there's a difference between responding like:
"Haha stfu you little bitch I'll beat you up irl"
and
"What the fuck is wrong with you asshole, how could you say that"

I feel as though the feedback report system needs to consider situations like this.

Yes Riots solution to everything is to "MUTE THEM" lol!

What a JOKE!

If someone is beating your mother on the street Riot devs would tell you to "MUTE THEM" lol!

Glad I stopped playing this game!

This here is the very problem with OCE riot staff. You offer a half ass solution when you should really stop it before it becomes a bigger issue. One would think after all these years that OCE has been running you would've learned, adapted and improved. Since the start of OCE I've only seen minor changes or improvements. Re-evaluate your punishment system to intercept toxicity from the start.

Can you tell us what the ban was for? You should have been notified which category it falls under when you received the ban.

If it is a chat related ban, then without a look at the chat logs, it's impossible to tell whether it was unfair. There's no indication whether you truly were a victim or whether you started as a victim but then contributed to a bad situation by being toxic yourself. As Aidan has already stated, you should have received an email and/or notification with the relevant chat logs, which you can feel free to post here for the community to discuss.

If you truly think the ban is unfair or made in error you can submit a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us) to appeal (you can also contact them if you have not received the relevant chat logs, or if you're unsure what you were actually banned for). They will take you through the process and make a decision on whether to revoke the ban or not.
